release.action: [mbox] the same (OS) user can now incrementally export multiple (iNotes) users mailboxes, and have iNotes Exporter correctly track the last export date for each one (previously there was only 1, shared, export date)
FreeBSD init.d scripts

Non-Oracle JVMs <= 6 (i.e. OpenJDK 6) do not implement java.net.CookieManager correctly (and anyway, having a JVM singleton (CookieHandler#setDefault(java.net.CookieHandler)) for cookies management sucks!). Manually manage cookies so that iNotes-exporter can run on all JVMs.
[maildir] new export format: MailDir
[pop3] new command: QUOTA
[pop3] login greeting message now warn when user is reaching its quota
[pop3] pop3 server is now multi-threaded (and thus multi-user)
[mbox] exporter now warn when user is reaching its quota
[mbox] lock output file to prevent concurrent access by other applications
jar file is now runnable: try java -jar iNotes-exporter-1.1-jar-with-dependencies.jar
[mbox] incremental export is now more intelligent, and stores the last export date to automatically continue on existing output file: no need to specify the export start date anymore!
[mbox] out file will be appended in case of partial export (i.e. when specifying a start date)
[mbox] tweak the export optional start date to include hour and minute
[mbox] add iNotes meta-data as X-iNotes- MIME headers
[mbox] only open the output file once logged in and meta retrieved
[pop3] add iNotes meta-data as X-iNotes- MIME headers
[pop3] handle client socket disconnection gracefully
more detailed logs (trace level) in case of need
misc small fixes and improvements
[pop3] pop3 server
[mbox] incremental exports
[maven] allow to build an uber-jar
performance updates (use streaming API)
[mbox] misc fixes (maven build, iNotes preferences leading to different default urls, paging for >1000 emails)
